newsitem.title: OMAN: Oman and Korea Gas Corp sign gas supply deal.
newsitem.headline: Oman and Korea Gas Corp sign gas supply deal.

text.p: Oman and Korea Gas Corp on Wednesday signed a 25-year sale and purchase agreement for the annual supply of 4.1 million tonnes of Omani liquefied natural gas (LNG) to the South Korean power utility.
The agreement represents the main export contract for the sultanate's $6 billion LNG project and formalises a supply agreement reached by the two sides in August.
Sales will be handled by the Oman LNG Company, a joint venture between the Omani government and foreign firms.
"This agreement marks the opening of a new era of commercial activity between the sultanate of Oman and South Korea," a joint statement released at the signing said.
Private shareholders are Royal Dutch Shell Group with 34 percent, Total SA six percent, Partex two percent, Mitsubishi Corp and Mitsui and Co three percent each and ITOCHU Corp one percent.
LNG supplies to Korea will start in early 2000.
Oman is also negotiating a SPA with Thailand's state oil and gas firm PTT for the annual supply of 2.2 million tonnes of LNG starting in 2003.
The Omani LNG plant near Sur in northeast Oman will have a capacity of 6.6 million tonnes a year.
